Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tmh44
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and myself found this place through trip-advisor and it is great! The staff was friendly, the rooms were spacious and the beds were comfortable. In the housekeeping dept, they just filled clean towels and pulled sheets up. Room could have used a vacuum after a few days. I'm guessing it is a "clean your own" sort of hotel. The breakfast was good! Could use some yogurt and possibly a meat such as sausage or bacon. The swimming pool was warm and clean with plenty of lounge chairs and tables. I loved the tropical surroundings of palm trees and other plants around the pool area. We also grilled a few steaks on the properties grills which were clean and in good working order. The location was wonderful situated right next to I-4 and very close to Disney theme parks. Thank you to the staff and esp. Brian at front desk! We will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but average otherwise”
Reviews.Author: NampaIdaho
Reviews.Content: The hotel is distinguished primarily by its location that is very convenient to Walt Disney World. However, it also happens to be right by the I-4, and if you happen to be one of the lucky ones with a room facing the interstate, prepare for a substantial amount of road noise. That's what we experienced. The hotel itself is average, though clean and in good repair overall. We enjoyed the fact that the rooms were suites (having three kids), but the hideaway bed was very poor quality. Thankfully, we just had small kids who didn't need a lot of extra support, but an adult would have had a very difficult time on that bed. The floor probably would have been better. There was a nice, good sized refrigerator / freezer together with a stove, microwave, sink, and dishwasher. They didn't have enough chairs for the suite, just two, so we had a very difficult time sitting around the table. They should have at least three chairs, probably four. The pool is located in the center of the complex. It's fairly large, very accessible, and in good condition. We were pleased with it. The clubhouse also is nice. The breakfast is probably about average, maybe a little above. They have precooked eggs, which don't look especially appetizing, but actually tasted pretty good. They also alternated between precooked waffles and french toast, both fairly tasty. They are sticklers for the bracelets that they give you at check in, which you are all supposed to wear at breakfast. Down sides for the hotel include the nearness to the interstate--we had a lot of road noise in our room, which was disappointing. If you have a room overlooking the pool or on the side away from the interstate, I imagine it wouldn't be nearly as disturbing. The interiors of the rooms are dated as well. They also make you pay for the entire visit up front, which kinds of smacks of second class operation. The room cleaning service was a little indifferent, not especially timely, and they only had two small garbage cans--one under the sink and one in the bathroom. It would have been nice to have another. Overall we were happy enough with our hotel, and pleased that it was so close to Walt Disney World, our destination, but if we went back, we'd probably pay a little more to move up the hotel range. The road noise was the biggest disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent place to stay with incredible service.”
Reviews.Author: Johnyz
Reviews.Content: There were approx 30 of us that came and stayed here. They met every expectation and exceeded several. Their staff went above and beyond. It was a great value for the price. The breakfast was more than sufficient. The room was clean and provided plenty of space. The staff went out of their way on several occasions to provide everything that we needed and more. We will definitely be staying there again. Thanks to the great staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Juan M
Reviews.Content: I recommend to everyone this hotel!!! Nice Breakfast and room has kitchen!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: anthony m
Reviews.Content: Super Nice place to stay, after a long 21hour drive to get there, it was really late after 11:pm I called them on the way there, to inform them that I will arrive late they held my one bedroom condo, I asked them for a pool view and they found one for us, it was important to us because, we want to keep an eye on my older son, when he’s in the pool he’s only 11yr old ,that was so nice of them, they gave us a place in Building #1 ROOM #112 / 1st floor, since I was so tired that was great, I didn’t have to carry all the bags up & down the stars and I had a lot of luggage, when we entered the room, we was surprised of how clean and roomy it was, the furniture was clean, and had nice feel/look to it, the first thing I notice was a large brand new 40in LCD Sony wide screen TV, and a blu ray player, they also have Free Cable TV, P.S went to a local Red box to rent some Blu Ray movies just down the road, that was cool! Anyway, I notice the full size kitchen, with brand new Whirlpool appliances/refrigerator, over the counter microwave, dishwasher, stove, that came in handy, my wife loves to cook, she cooked two dinners there and we saved money too! The living room had a couch that opens up to a bed, also a chair with ottoman, and a table to eat, with only two chairs but it was ok, my kids ate first, then me and my wife, also the condo sleeps six, also had an overhead fan that was nice since I don’t like to use the air conditioner if it’s not that hot, but the AC worked well and it was quiet, the bedroom had two double beds nicely made up, with fresh clean sheets, when I went into the bedroom I notice, a large LG 37in wide screen TV on the wall, how cool is that! Get this, on the night stand there was a ILUV Clock radio with iphone/iPod docking you can play your own music from them, or just to charge them, and it also had a bed shaker and speaker for me that was nice since I am a little hard to wake up, it was very quiet and I slept good the whole time, I asked the maid if all of the units was so updated like this one was? She said yes, that some are, and some they are working on it, the property seemed well maintained and clean and it’s a good thing that I brought my laptop computer, they have Free internet/wifi, also you can use the desk top computer in the lobby my son loved it that’s for sure, I stayed 1week and I and the kids really enjoyed it. They also have a game room where my son made some friends his own age; the staff was very friendly and helpful. Everyone was very nice. The breakfast buffet was really good. they had Eggs, Waffles, Pastries, Bagles, Hot & Cold Cereals, juices, milk, Coffee Tea, we saved a lot of money, for a family of four, I would have paid $60 a day from somewhere else, like $360 just on breakfast alone for the six days that I stayed there, also the pool was heated and it was crystal clear, I am a fanatic about clean pools because I have a small child 5yr old, he may sometimes drink the water, he is learning how to swim, they also have a children’s pool in good condition ,and a nice big Jacuzzi tub, that was good for me after a long day at the park to relax, also they have a nice exercise room, loved the massage chair, not to mention they also have a Gazebo with a gas Grill, Sports Court, you can get a basket ball at the front desk, my son did, and they have a large send box for the kids, and they also have Laundry facilities, and plenty of free parking, and it’s only like 6:min from here to Disney World I think just over a mile or so, and they have free Shuttle service, if you don’t feel like driving, what more can, I say! I absolutely love this place, I have paid a lot more to stay at other hotels with no condo just two double beds, and they did not even come close to what I got there, I will positively come back next year. Thanks for reading my revue. ANTHONY P.S I have read some revues that was negative about this place, I think it is a total lie, perhaps it is from the competition, I know that there are only 500 or so hotels in the area, that must be the case.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: tjv38
Reviews.Content: very nice place nothing to fancy, but stayed 1week and really enjoyed. the staff was very friendly and helpful. everyone was very nice. the breakfast was great. also pool and hot tub great. loved the massage chair.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel that could be so much more”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeNovak
Reviews.Content: I was attending a convention at the nearby Gaylord Palms, as chose this hotel as a lower priced option. With Florida resident pricing, I paid 80 including tax and resort fee. For the Orlando area, this is an excellent price considering the location and size of room. Check-in was a bit slow, as there was only a single desk clerk. He seemed vaguely interested in his job and he was dressed as if he slept in his clothes. I don't expect suit and tie, but desk staff should not look like the plumber. The reservation was all in order and I was checked in without any issues. I did ask for a room away from the highway (eight lanes of I-4) and was assured the building was in a quiet area. For my parking pass I had to go to the attractions counter and talk to a young lady. Apparently this hotel makes money from Disney tickets, but I was leaving town the following day. For me, this second counter visit was a waste of time. I was booked into building 7, which is in the outer ring with one part facing the highway. The Palms seems to be an old Homewood suites, as I noticed their familiar "duck" logos still in various locations. My guess is that Hilton sold off the property and it is under new management. Homewood suites are nicely designed, so this hotel has a good foundation. I was on the third floor at the end of the building. I generally don't like rooms located next to a stairwell (due to security and noise issues), but the stairs were more convenient than the old elevator in the middle of the building. I was surprised that the 3rd floor entry door was not secured, and shocked to see the locking mechanism was gutted. This is a huge security issue that seems to have been done in response to the fire code. I would rather have a locked fire-door than sleep in an unsecured building in Orlando (an area with a high crime rate). The Palms uses magnetic strip key locks, and one of my cards did not work. The unlocking process seemed to be hit and miss, which could result in guest dissatisfaction. The amount of time spent going back and forth for new keys is magnified by the size of the facility. In the Florida heat or rain, this process would be extremely dis-pleasurable for a guest. The room itself was large and very clean. The furniture seemed new and there were no overt stains on the linens, floors or furniture. There was a full kitchen with two microwaves (I assumed the one over oven was not functional). The bedroom was separate, with two double beds. The bathroom was a long room, and it held the only closet. I didn't mind, but this would be an odd arrangement even with two people in the room. I don't think a bathroom is the best place for a closet. The hotel offers free wireless Internet, which worked perfectly on both of my devices. This was not the case at the Gaylord Hotel which has at least 20 competing for-pay WI-FI networks. Kudos to the Palms for providing this service freely. Most hotels charge a resort fee and then also charge a per computer, per day fee. The beds were clean, but very hard and you could feel the springs. I found it difficult to sleep and it only got worse when the traffic started at 6am. When I went to bed the room was fairly quiet, but in the morning I discovered than I was a few hundred yards away from a major highway. The double pane windows did very little to stop the noise, and by 6:30 I gave up sleeping. The bed was killing my back anyway, and I found the couch much quieter and softer. I managed to get 30 minutes on the couch before I decided to start my day. The hotel includes free breakfast in a clean dining room at the hotel lobby. The food isn't great in taste or variety, but it is better than many meals you will pay for in Orlando. The eggs were well cooked and the french toast was nicely prepared. Considering the cost of everything in the Disney area, this was easily a $15 breakfast. Checkout out was easy, and there were no hidden charges on the bill. I did mention that my room was noisy, but there was no compensation offered. In short, this is a good hotel that could be much better. The rates and location are excellent, though the location is next to a major highway. I would consider petitioning the state for a sound wall to easy the noise. The desk staff are satisfactory, though dress code should be addressed. I would strongly suggest securing the outer doors of all buildings or add exit only fire doors. Also a concern the is outdated guest room door lock system. A few needed upgrades and this hotel would become an excellent facility.

Reviews.Title: “It Aint "The Ritz." But, It Aint Bad Either”
Reviews.Author: Family-Traveling-Man
Reviews.Content: The good things about this property start with its location; right off of Irlo Bronson Highway, route 192, at its junction w/I-4, just down the road from Disney's main gate. But, it doesn't stop there. They offer a free, and rather substantial, continental breakfast, free shuttle service to and from Disney World, and the property includes a medium-to-large sized pool area that is well landscaped with palm trees, and includes a gazebo with gas grills available for barbecueing.. There is also a large laundry room with plenty of coin operated washing machines, and a game room with five (5) coin operated video games, and an air hockey table. The lobby area doubles as a sitting room during the evenings, where people sit, have their coffee, and chat, or read a book during the evenings. They also offer complimentary use of a desk top computer with a thrity minute time limit for each patron. There is also a basketball hoop, and half court for anyone who wants to get some outdoor excersize. Our room was a one bedroom villa (two rooms total), with two double beds, and a fold out couch. There was a kitchen area complete with refridgerator, stove top, microwave, sink, and dishwasher. The unit was well appointed, and accomodated our party of five comfortably. The only problem we had was that five people are probably too many for one bathroom. We'll keep that in mind when booking future trips. There were some drawbacks, as there are with all properties. First off, let me state that the property is not dirty. But, some parts of it are a little "worn." For instance some of the woodworking in the hallways, and in the units have marks and scars from people banging their luggage into it. The bathroom in our unit was very clean. However, the grouting around the tub, and the molding on the walls in the bathroom could use an "update." Also, I noticed that the basketball hoop was "drooping" a little bit, and in need of repair. The light bulbs in our unit were only 40 watts when we originally showed up, and we had to ask maintenance to replace them with brighter bulbs. Additionally, the door on the refridgerator opened in such a fashion that the it blocks access to the sink and stove; instead of opening from right to left which would have allowed one to take articles out of it while reaching the sink and stove counter. And finally, building #7, has one side that faces I-4, and gets all kinds of highway noise. You probably wouldn't be too happy if you were put in one of those units. When all is said and done, the positives far out weigh the negatives at this property, and we would definitely stay there again. Some parts of it can use some "updating". But, all in all, its a very good place to stay. I would also like to recognize the efforts of a desk clerk by the name of Brian, who helped us retain our reservation, even though we were a day late because of car trouble while enroute. Also, I must commend the general manager (I think his name is "Gene") for making the rounds at breakfast, shaking hands, and greeting guests individually. It was a nice touch. We would definitely recomend this place to families on a budget, who want the amenities of a larger hotel without paying the extra $ usually associated with larger name brand locations. I should also mention here that there are inumerable places to eat and shop right around the corner on Irlo Bronson Highway. Steak restaraunts, buffets, Italian, quick-food, whatever you want; Its all within short-to-medium walking / very short driving distance from the property. We give this place a four (4) on a scale of one (1) to five (5), and we definitely recommend it positively.

Reviews.Title: “Palms Hotel & Villas”
Reviews.Author: Marymscintalogalbo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed on this property 4 times, have always found it to be excellent, the staff being more than helpful! The beautiful girl(Maria) who takes care of the breakfast all alone is so efficient, We do not know how she does it, and she always has a smile! The front desk people, especially Joey and Brian, are supermen!!! They handle whatever comes their way, with ease! We were there from Feb. 14- March 1st, Daytona week, NBA week,( very crowded) went off without a hitch! We also appreciated the maintainence man, who took care of the T.V.( we didn't know how to program it) always with a smile! the cleaning staff, how much more could I say? Wonderfully efficient! The manager who greeted us every morning, what a guy!! We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeding expectations at every corner...”
Reviews.Author: Chaz B
Reviews.Content: We started our 3 day Disney vacation by arriving in Orlando at 8:30am on Friday morning. We had arranged to meet up with some friends at the hotel and carpool to the park. I walked inside and explained to Brian that we were 7 hours early for our reservation, but asked for a parking pass so we could leave 1 car there for the day. He told me not only could we have the pass, but he would check us in early because the room was already clean and we wouldnt have to leave our things in our cars, we could put them in the room. I was impressed to say the least!!! Brian went on to ask me if this was our first trip to Disney, which it was. He recommended some things to do with the kids in Downtown Disney and also referred me to their Disney counter. We left, had a great day at the park, enjoyed the pool, took advantage of Brian's recommendations, and called it a day. When we woke up on Saturday, we ran downstairs, had the breakfast (A+ once again), and took off for that park, not expecting housekeeping after the 1st day. When we returned to the room after a full day (9am-11pm) at the park the room looked as if we had never been there, It was in pristine condition and the only sign of us was that whoever cleaned the room had folded up our kids' blankets and laid them on the beds next to their stuffed animals, ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! We were truly sad to leave on Sunday morning, can't wait to go back. Our friends actually booked a weekend for their parents we had such a great experience.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: JenniferCruz01
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed from feburary 29-March 3,2012 and our room was excellent for the price we paid. we loved the fact that the hotel was close to Walt Disney world and universal studios, the room was very clean and it also had kithchen accessories for our kitchen with housekeeping coming to our room every morning with fresh towels.the staff was very nice and we used the outdoor heated pool which was very clean and we also used the laundry room which was clean also.our breakfeast was good with french toast and eggs also coffee and cereal every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Business Freindly”
Reviews.Author: Bill G
Reviews.Content: I do a lot of business in Orlando and The Palms is very accessible to anywhere in Central Fl. It is right on I-4 quiet and very clean. The rooms are super large with full kitchens and the staff very friendly. They have a great reputation and I highly recommend them for short stays and long term rentals.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay and Great Price!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisad1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights Feb20-24, 2012 and we were very pleased with our onebedroom suite, it was equipped with the things we needed. We had two kids 15 year old and a five month old so having a crib in the room was great. The staff was very friendly upon check in and said Hi everytime we had passed them. The free breakfast was good, you had cereal, oatmeal, eggs, bagels, toast, and danishes and juice, the coffee was not good os dont drink it but everything else was good!! The pool and hot ub areas were nice and my oldest made use of the pool and hot tub and they had a game room which satisifed my son, and the guest laundry was nice we were able to wash some clothes. The rooms were nice a little beat up but you can not expect every hotel to be top of the line, but even with some wear and tear it was clean, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom are roomy, not big but had plenty of room. Overall i was very satisfied with this hotel and would definitely stay there again. Just keep in mind that it is a little worn but most of the hotels in the area are. The highway is behind the hotel but we didnt hear any of the trafic so it was quietier than we thought. So if your on a budget and wanty a clean room and free breakfast to satisfy your need then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Starmoon81
Reviews.Content: Wonderful family place, great breakfast, pool nice and clean, comfy rooms fully stocked…We travel often and we have never seen a General Manager of a hotel go table by table during breakfast in the morning asking guest how they are, how their stay is going so far and just greeting people and welcoming them to the hotel; this act (at least) to our family made us feel like these folks really CARE about their guest, which made us feel safe that everything was going to go well during our stay.Mr. Brian Serra at the main office is an asset to this hotel without a doubt! He is on top of everything and made our stay a terrific one and the same feeling that the Manager transmitted on everybody, Brian did as well. What a duo! what a family friendly hotel, what a service! Excellent choice! We would stay NO WHERE ELSE! THANK YOU PALMS!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay- especially for visitors from outside U.S.”
Reviews.Author: Viechell S
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed in the Palms in Feb 2012, this was not our first stay in the area, but our first at the Palms, we have visited the Kissimmee area before and stayed in similar sort of Villas, this time around we decided to try another new adventure and it paid off. The Palms is located very close to the parks/attractions, approximately 5 -10 minutes from Disney / Sea World, there is free shuttle that is very dependable if required. The hotel itself is very clean and well kept, the staff are very friendly, there is a pool, jacuzzi, games, laundry facility and most importantly there is breakfast every morning and its Free!!. The breakfast comes in well especially when you have to go to the parks early, you can simply stop by the restaurant area on your way out, some days I even packed to go. The hotel is located just off the Irlo Brownson Memorial Highway (it will take you three minutes walk), once you're on that strip there is every single restaurant that you can think off, Old Town is on that highway about 5 minutes drive up, there are many attractions in the area. Going back to the 'hotel' the rooms are well kept, clean and comfortable, I read some reviews before I booked this hotel, the majority were good reviews there were the few negatives, but you get more than what you pay for if you stay at this hotel, I would definitely return and encourage my friends to go as well.

Reviews.Title: “OUT STANDING !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen V
Reviews.Content: We were pleased way beyond what we expected. VERY CLEAN. The cleanest rooms I have been in to begin with, and that excepts pets. No smells from other pets, no fear of fleas, or pet dander.I keep my Yorkie very well groomed at all times, this place was a refreshing surprise. Our Villa slept 5 of us. The staff, from check-in to check-out way above professional standards. The pool, heated and clean as was the hot tub spa. The free breakfast was elaborate every morning. Grills by the pool, stove, refrigerator, microwave all clean for use. Dishes and utensils are in the rooms and clean. Close to all Parks and shuttles on-site. I would stay here again anytime. You made my stay a wonderful and stress free vacation. I would also like to say NO ONES DOGS BARKED at all anytime. We all cleaned up after our dogs also.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again!”
Reviews.Author: NatalieS125
Reviews.Content: My two teenage daughters and myself stayed here in Feb 2012 for our first ever trip to Florida.. We found the place to be a great value for the $ spent.. Staff was knowledgable and courteous; our room was clean, inviting and spacious; the elaborate continental breakfast was wonderful! We were a close drive to Walt Disney World as well which was great. I would definitely recommend the Palms and would stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: LifeisTooShortSoLive
Reviews.Content: My family and I visit Kissimmee typically twice a year. We have young children and family close by and we just love the area. Each time we visit, we always stay at The Palms Hotel and Villas. We find the convenience to the parks and the reasonable price perfect for us in many ways. From the free breakfast for the whole family to the heated pool and jacuzzi, the property is perfect. The large condominium apartments are awesome too. You get a full apartment for the price of a hotel room, which is great for extended stays. I'd recommend this property to anyone coming to the area!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ronald S
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with the area and the room was very good and clean. The staff was very accommodating. The pool area was clean and we enjoyed the pool very much. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “we go numerous times a year!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jess S
Reviews.Content: the staff is great!! great selection of breakfast food!! The price is great and villas are spacious!! This is the only hotel we stay at when we visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Stacy-Sheboygan, WI”
Reviews.Author: Stacy S
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed at this hotel every time we have come to Florida. I came down to participate in the Disney 1/2 marathon and chose to stay here again. You can't beat the price of the rooms, especially when bringing a family on vacation. We love the fact that we can all be in the same room and not be tripping over each other. When I stayed by myself this time, Brian, the front desk manager recognized me from a previous stay. The staff is very helpful in answering questions, getting extra towels/pillows if needed. We couldn't have found a better place to stay as the staff is excellent and so is the value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Sam D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between christmas & new year 2011 and thought it was lovely, really friendly staff always willing to help, very clean rooms and dining area, lovely food, & beautifully decorated christmas trees aswell! The pools were lovely too and had a bbq area which we used one night aswell which was great. Was a good location for getting to the parks and for eating out and shopping. Great value for money and would definately go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and hotel for this price/quality”
Reviews.Author: Mterry2948
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying that the price point for a hotel of this quality is unbeatable. For a modest price, you can stay at a hotel that includes rooms having a separate bedroom, a pull out couch, a full kitchenette, and two TVs. Quality-wise, the rooms were clean and well-kept, the cleaning staff was top-notch (I left the chambermaid a nice tip) and there was a decent breakfast (inclusive). I have a wife and two children and we just can't stay in a standard Disneyworld room with two beds. They are two small. And getting a suite with a separate bedroom is cost prohibitive at Disneyworld. For a more economical price, you can get so much more at the Palms Villas. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: GoofyGal70151
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Disney 2012 Goofy Challenge. This place is amazing. If you are looking for contemporary design,state of the art appliances, or "new" carpet--GET OVER IT! The service here outweighs anything that you could attempt to find wrong. They take any requests seriously and work to provide you with what you need. Stayed here for Disney Goofy Challenge event. I was provided with a quiet room (yes, there was no noise outside the entire night) which was requested when making the reservation. From making the reservation, checking in, and checking out--it was seamless. The housekeeping staff does not bother you unless you want new linens, and they provide them without hesitation. The rooms we had came equipped with a full kitchen where we could store our own food. Or we had the additional option of restaurants right next door or a Publix grocery store right up the street. I happened to stay here for running Disney. Forget the hassle and angst of driving over from elsewhere--THIS HOTEL IS IN THE PERFECT SPOT for running Disney. One right turn out of the hotel and you are there without even getting back on to the highway. And even more so than convenience, this was a comfortable place to sleep! The beds are a heavenly mass of cloud-like comfort. I could not believe that I fell asleep every night immediately and without discomfort. We liked staying here so much that we are planning to bring our family reunion back here in the fall. You will not regret staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Get-a-Way from the Canadian Winter!!”
Reviews.Author: Roman C
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Palms at least once a year since 2005 and have enjoyed every stay. Great value for the price we pay. The new management has started to upgrade the grounds as well as some of the rooms. Love the villa style of rooms and the pool area is just beautiful. The pool is heated and there is a hot-tub as well. The free breakfast has some variety and there is 24 hr coffee and tea. While there is no restaurant on-site, there is quite a variety of excellent restaurants within walking distance of the resort. Staff is very friendly and helpful, especially Joey B. Always feel very welcome here as if it were our second home. If you are going to do the attractions there is a free shuttle service and the Palms is just minutes from Disney. Tons of shopping and malls just a short distance away. We will be retiring this year and will be making the Palms our choice to stay for a month each year during the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, worth considering”
Reviews.Author: JKDC
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for two reasons: its convenient location near Disney World, and the fact that it offered "suites" with a separate room for our kids. So let me address each of these in turn. (The fact that the hotel was inexpensive certainly helped, too, but prices fluctuate so much that I won't comment further here.) The location was fantastic! This hotel is just off of 192 (Irlo Bronson Highway), and only 5 minutes to the Disney area (about 10 minutes to Epcot, slightly further to the Magic Kingdom). And you avoid the traffic on I-4 and International Drive. (The location made our trip, as we were able to easily go back-and-forth from the parks to our hotel each afternoon.) In addition, the hotel is not far from drug stores, a supermarket, a Starbucks, and a boardwalk/small theme park ("old town") that was nice to walk around at night. I would recommend the hotel for the location alone (though there are several other hotels in the immediate area). There was, indeed, a pull-out couch for our kids and a door dividing our room from theirs. Overall, though, I was disappointed in the rooms. The pull-out couch did not look very comfortable (fortunately our kids are young and did not mind). The room was a bit small. The kitchen was not very well stocked or organized: very limited cookware, a barely functional stove, and a fridge (but no oven). Overall, though, the room was reasonable for the price we paid. Definitely "no frills," though. Our room faced I-4 and we could hear the traffic at night: be warned if you are a light sleeper. The pool was nice, and there was a jacuzzi also. Wish they provided bigger towels. The free breakfast was ok, but nothing special. (Limited selection of cereals, bagels, frozen waffles, muffins, and oranges.) We had some problems with housekeeping: they didn't get to our room until around 3:30 in the afternoon, which was just when we were returning from the parks. The day after we complained, however, they did come earlier. The staff was friendly enough when we brought this to their attention, but they did not come earlier the rest of our stay. Overall, this is an excellent choice for a "family-friendly" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Vacations”
Reviews.Author: Cariduro55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this villa from 21 to 27 Nov. We also had our 3 grandchildren with us. We had a wonderfull time. The villa was dated but very clean and convenient when visitng Disney. We first rented a 1 bedroom but we considered the sofabed in the living room too hard for the kids to share sinc they wanted to be together so we decided to upgraded to a larger villa next morning. First thing next morning we spoke with the front desk and before we shuttle to Disney we moved. We loved it, and the kids really appreciated the heated pool. Breakfast was a good start. I will recommend this hotel to my family, and I will return myself when I get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, real value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 18 nights in October during our visit to Disney World. Our room was really spacious and comfortable and the location of the hotel is nothing short of excellent; minutes away from a wide choice of restaurants and steak-houses, and a short drive to the Disney parks. The Palms is a perfect home from home, with friendly and professional staff who are only to glad to help. It is also one of the few hotels in the area to offer parking, wifi and an excellent fresh breakfast all free of charge. This wasn't our first stay in the Palms, nor will it be our last. Andrew and Chloe, UK.

Reviews.Title: “It served it's purpose but with no extra benefits.”
Reviews.Author: marierider
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Orlando for a four nights stay while he had a conference at the Gaylord. The room was clean. The sheets were soft. I think the bed was comfortable but honestly, we were so tired every day that I could have slept anywhere. It was nice to have a full size fridge to keep snacks and drinks in while I was in and out of the room. However, the selection of glasses and dishes was very minimal. It would have been nice to have had a light in the bathroom closet; it was very dark and hard to see inside it. The bathroom was clean and the vanity had plenty of room for all of our stuff. The floors were all clean; I walked barefoot most of the time and never had blackened feet. My biggest complaint about this hotel was the below par breakfast. They offered milk, juice, coffee and tea, so that was great. They also offered cereal and pastries which was also nice. However, while most hotels now offer waffle makers, the palms offered frozen waffles...very cheap. They did have eggs but no bacon or sausage. There was no fruit of any kind. It was all carbs, carbs and more carbs. It would have been great to have had some fruit and yogurt and definitely some meat of some kind. The pool area was clean and towels were provided. The drive from here to Gaylord was very easy so that was great! On arrival, I noticed our TV in the living area wasn't working, so I called the front desk and within five minutes someone from maintence came and fixed it. Please note that this hotel is yards away from I-4; so the noise is loud from the traffic. Overall, the price wasn't terrible; I just really expected a better breakfast; everything else I can live with. We'd stay here again mainly for the benefit of a kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Disney World's Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: LeslieRG
Reviews.Content: We keep going back and it gets better and better. In the last 6 months we have been to Disney approximately 4 times and each time we go back we ALWAYS stay at this hotel (and have been staying here for years). It has everything you could need for a great vacation and much more!!!! It has a full kitchen, amazing breakfast (included with the rate) and many more amenities such as fitness room, pool, hot tub, and grills for a great bbq. The staff is very friendly and helpful - especially Brian. Each and every time we go back to this hotel, we are met with great customer service that is very rare these days!!! This hotel is affordable, comfortable, enjoyable and very very close to all the parks and attractions. Keep up the good work and customer service!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Old & tired..”
Reviews.Author: Panzer88
Reviews.Content: We had no major issues, but lots of little things added up to a subpar stay. Carpets were worn &a not entirely clean. Room has a kitchen, but poor selection of flatware & dishes. Dishwasher door was rusty & bent. The property itself shows signs of general neglect. We noticed several units with cracked windows while walking the property. On a positive note, the staff was friendly & it was a cheap stay. Would not stay here again though..

Reviews.Title: “Overall, A Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lea0222
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Orlando for the MLG competition at the Gaylord Palms. We didn't want to stay on site so we looked for reasonable hotels in the area. We booked the online pre-paid rate for a King for four nights. The rate was around 67 per night plus tax and the resort fee. The Good: To be honest, we didn't need the kitchen area, but it was nice to have a separate section off from the bedroom. The fridge was dated but worked and seemed clean enough. Older appliances can only be kept so clean. The room itself was alright. It was very clean, just dated. I think we paid about the right price for what we got. Overall it seemed like it had been built cheaply but kept in pretty good repair. We never received housekeeping service because we kept our privacy sign on the entire stay. There were plenty of linens in the room for us to even have towels left over at the end of our stay so we never really needed service. Loved the bed, we slept very well on it. Also, all the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. The Bad: On a King bed there were only three pillows which I thought was rather odd, but not a huge deal. There was an extra one in the bathroom closet (I assume for the sofa pullout which we didn’t use) but it didn’t have a pillow case on it. I also noticed that none of the pillows had protectors on them. Working in the hotel industry myself, that raised a huge red flag. When we arrived we noticed that a bed room lamp and the light above the toilet were not working. I reported the lamp issue to the desk, but since we left the sign on the entire time it was never fixed. It didn’t bother us so we didn’t mind not having it work, but still, housekeeping should have noticed this when they cleaned the room to make it vacant. The carpet was probably the worst thing about them room. As soon as I put my bare feet on it I knew it needed to be cleaned. It had that sticky feeling that dirty carpet has. When I looked at the bottom of my feet late on the first night we were there, they had a turned gray so I wore socks or shoes for the rest of the stay. Other Comments: It is well in the back of a road with a lot of other hotels but the area was very quiet. I don’t know if it was just the off season, or if that is normal. I suppose you are within walking distance to restaurants, but it is a nice piece down that road. The location of the event we were there for was a little over 2 miles according to Google but it seemed like longer than that. Several other people we knew had booked there as well and hadn’t brought a car which ended up being a major problem for them. We never used the pool or went to breakfast so I can’t comment on any of that. Overall it was a decent stay and I felt he value for what we paid was about right.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: bunnysgal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! It was clean and well kept. We also stayed witha sports team and it was loud. I would recommend asking for a room that faces the parking lot. That kept the noise to a minimum. I had a 2 year old who slept well during the day and in the evening. It was homey nad close to Wal-Mart and Disney. Some of the TV's and appliances are out-dated and varied a lot by room. But overall, it's a great price that's close to the action. and the warm buffet breakfast that's included kept costs down.

Reviews.Title: “OK...but wouldn't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: CanadiangirlOttawa
Reviews.Content: The room was a good size and the kitchen convenient. Had a few sports teams staying so it was loud till all hours of the night. Room key was a pain...had to have it changed almost everyday as we got locked out regularly. Didn't have enough blankets for the pull out. Carpet was completely worn in some spots. Our room was rarely restocked with coffee, dish detergent or conditioner. I think it happened to others as well as I always saw people taking tray loads of coffee from the breakfast bar to their room. The breakfast was pretty bad with no fruit in sight. The shuttle was great and always on time. The pool always had bugs floating around in it but was a good size and temp. Hot tub was nice after a long day at Disney. The kitchen was missing dishes...only had 3 bowls and 2 glasses for 5 people. But we made the best of what we were given!!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: Polo202
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible! Beware of this hotel! We traveled as a large group with young athletes competing at the ESPN Center. We booked here because we thought it would be convenient to the Center. Wow, were we sorry! The conveniet location didn't make up for the poor condition of the rooms and the overall shoddy maintenance and the noise. One night there were loud police sirens around the complex and if you were unfortunate enough to have rooms on one side of the building there was truck noise all night long. Our coach ended up having to change rooms at 2:00 in the morning the night before the event. The management was not at all helpful. It was so bad we wanted to check out and provided notice 48 hours in advance yet were told that we would still be charged for the additional night on the three night reservation. Not the place you want to be with a group of kids, or frankly at all if you are looking for a pleasant vacation. It was very seedy and none of us felt secure. There even seemed to be transients living long term in some of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Our kissimmee get-away spot for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Starmoon81
Reviews.Content: Great family friendly place, the front desk staff is remarkable! great service= feeling cared for...Will absolutely come back in a blink!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Geronimo12
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several hotels in Kissimmee, but none compare to the Palm Hotel. We were greeted by Brian who made it his mission to be sure we had everything we needed. The breakfast buffet was nice, although we would have preferred fresh waffles the frozen we okay. The Lady keeping up the Buffet didnt miss a beat with keeping everything nice and clean. Plan on aking this our hotel when we stay in Kissimmee From now on. Hot tub could have been filled higher. Everything was very clean!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tgcitw
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for two nights before checking into our Disney Hotel, the lobby was beautiful and the grounds were well lit with a visable security guard making rounds. Parking was plenty. The rooms while they looked to have been furnished by some one in the 1980's were very clean. But I was shocked how huge they were. We got a standard room which was a living room with tv and kitchen area, then a bedroom with tv and 2 beds and a huge bathroom. The living rooms couch was also a bed. two days cost me 155.00. I loved the breakfast but my wife complained there was no cheese for the eggs. Bout ten minutes from disney. Almost wished I stayed here in-stead of at the disney hotel. Great hotel stay here you wont be let down.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful visit at The Palms”
Reviews.Author: LifeisTooShortSoLive
Reviews.Content: We came down for a ten day Disney and SeaWorld vacation over the July 4th holiday and had a wonderful time at The Palms Hotel and Villas. It's always nice to have not just a tiny hotel room, but a full condo with living room, bedroom, bathroom and kitchen....like home away from home. We noticed much of the property had been repainted since our last visit, which looked great and our kids had a blast in the heated pool and hot tub (as always) on one of the evenings it was a bit cool out. Breakfast is always good and the staff is very kind. I'd recommend this to any family coming into town!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: MrKite58
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Palms on 3 different occasions now, and have always found the staff to be very friendly and helpful (especially Brian at the front desk), the rooms, while a bit dated, are clean and comfortable, and the breakfast is very good. The location is fantastic if you are doing the local attractions. Overall, I love this place, and the price is excellent! I will stay there whenever I'm in town..

Reviews.Title: “Loved it they saved my vacation”
Reviews.Author: MemaAlice
Reviews.Content: I had booked another hotel that turned into a nightmare (very unsafe)and checked out . I called The Palms and got a lovely suite that was perfect. I felt very safe, very comfortable and had everything I needed. The staff was prefect. I will definitely stay here again. I cannot say enough to express my thanks to the staff at The Palms Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great; highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Amidala516
Reviews.Content: Please don't pay attention to the bad reviews. I live very close to this resort and it's our first choice for when friends and family come to visit. We also had to stay here a few times ourselves due to our own condo's maintenance issues. For the price, this place is amazing. Try to find a quality resort this close to Disney for less than $100 with a full living room that sleeps 6 that also has a breakfast, free shuttle, and 24 hours of coffee and tea. Each time we or our family has stayed here the staff has been very friendly and accommodating and the rooms are always clean. We used to always stay on Disney property but The Palms is a much better value for the $$.

Reviews.Title: “Very different from website”
Reviews.Author: j_gerba
Reviews.Content: Checked out hotel on web, the place looked great, like brand new. Only when we arrived did we find out that alot of things needed repaired and updated. The toilet clogged on the first night, twice, got moved to what they called an upgrade near pool, that room was filthy. They moved us to another room which was o.k. The pool needed a good cleaning, algae was all around the sides. Breakfast was good. Service was good. Would stay maybe again, if place was upgraded. It is very convenient to parks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but dated!”
Reviews.Author: luckyme22
Reviews.Content: This is a friendly hotel! Rooms are a bit dated. Breakfast was ok I guess I never ate it but my husband and kids "it was ok". The pool was always kept clean and was hardly crowed, which was a plus for us!. Overall nice place to stay and I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Kids love the Pool!”
Reviews.Author: LifeisTooShortSoLive
Reviews.Content: We had a week in Kissimmee for Easter and The Palms treated us great. The kids stayed in the pool non-stop when we were not visiting the parks and we got great pictures that we'll keep forever. :-) I'm a big fan of the breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY MADE DISNEY TRIP WONDERFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: xlovingxlindax
Reviews.Content: I totally enjoyed staying here!! The area was nice and convenient. The rooms were great! We booked a suite with a small kitchen, a sofa bed, a bedroom with two queen beds and a bathroom. It was great for a family of 6 and a puppy! Staff was totally friendly and helpful! There was a pool and little sand box area. Rooms were clean and the kitchen was stocked with all the necessities like pots and pans, knives, cookware, utensils, napkins, etc. Originally I was going to book the rooms for a week at a higher rate just because it seemed so wonderful but I waited too long and the rooms got booked before I could get my hands on them and now I see why they went so fast. The place was nice!! Then later I was able to stay there for the latter part of my trip at a much discounted rate and that was even better because I was willing to pay full price for the room because it was that great but the fact that I got it at a lower discounted rate made the stay even more worth it!!! Definitely will have to stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a family.”
Reviews.Author: flfamtravels
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel. This is our 3rd trip to the Orlando area within the last 6 months and we were very happy at the palms. Very good price. The pull out sofa came in handy. The free breakfast was a plus and the location is good. The staff was very friendly and went above and beyond. They were very helpful. The hotel also had free cookies that the kids loved after a day at the parks and attractions. We had no problems here and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: kren3256
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast - lots of choices. Extremely comfortable beds...best night's sleep on the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Palms”
Reviews.Author: OysterMag
Reviews.Content: As a professional travel writer I look forward to my stays at the Palms. It is such a lovely slice of the past. The rooms are wonderful and comfortable. The staff is warm and welcoming. Brian, the front desk supervisor is always going above and beyond to ensure that everyone's stay is perfect. The property has several buildings and a clubhouse. The rooms are well outfitted and the beds are grand and comfortable. The hotel is easily situated just off the highway, making it a short hop to anywhere. The free breakfast is just a great plus to wake up to. If you are looking for the perfect place to spend your holiday, I cannot recommend The Palms enough. Possibly the best value in the Orlando.Kissimmee area. The Palms is consistently one of my top recommends whilst visiting the area. Great for families, singles, business or for your special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “not as happy as i planned”
Reviews.Author: angellgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had made our reservations two months in advance. We called before we left our home three 1/2 hours away.We comfirmed our reservation. When we went to check in our room was taken. Our reservation I guess weren't enough to hold the room we needed or requested. We got 1/2 off the full price of the reservation, but still we needed the big room for our big family. Turns out they only have two of the 2/2's that are the biggest they offer. To make matters whose we have a handicapp daughter in a wheelchair. My husband had to carry her up and down the stairs every time we came back or left. We left the wheelchair in the van since it was to heavy to carry up stairs. They had no elevator. Once my husband unloaded all of us stuff in the living room he decided to look in the bedrooms too see we had one less bathroom and the master bedroom had a double bed and no closet. It was the size of a closet. The other bedroom had two queen beds. Needless to say we didn't sleep together on our family vacation. The pool was freezing cold in March. We enjoyed the free breakfast if we made it by 9am to get food. I kept apoligizing to people in the breakfast area. It felt like I was back at home with a house full of people and we were all in eachothers way.The villas were busy on the weekends. The food, drinks and toasters were all over the place. Two different sides of the room. The eggs looked like egg beaters and they were burnt everyday. They offered 4 different kinds of cerel and a mixture of fruit. It looked really weird. They also had fench toast or waffles, but they were weird looking too. We enjoyed the pasteries and bagels with cream cheese. The hotel/ villas was at the back of the road we travelled down. The up side was we were in the first building which was nice to get in and out and right over to breakfast. The bummer was that we had to drive over 6 speed bumps to get to our hotel/villas. The baby would be asleep on the way home and after all those bumps she was awake again. I am looking into other places to stay next time. It looked clean, but i did read that they only give you new towels on tuesday and fridays. So the towels I had on the floor did they just hang them back up??? I was surprised to hear how broken adn un clean some of the rooms where. I didn't have that experiance. Our room was clean and I know that my bath and shower were at least wiped out everyday. It was nice to come back from a day at Disney to see beds made adn rooms picked up.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump! I would give it ZERO stars!”
Reviews.Author: erpayne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in urgent need of a remodel! It is run down and old. My family and I checked into a king suite on the bottom floor. When we were in bed the first night we couldn't sleep because we were afraid the people above us were going to come through the roof! My husband went to the front desk to get us moved to a new room & were told the units are individually owned. They gave us a 3rd floor room & my husband told them we didn't won't the same thing happening to others below us so he was told no one was checking in until the days we were leaving... This place is great if you are on a budget. It is very dirty & our room didn't get cleaned the first two days! There is also a "RESORT" fee of $8 a day for "FREE WIFI"!! I would give this hotel zero stars but it is in a good location & has a continental breakfast. I suggest paying the extra money for a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit and can't wait to stay again”
Reviews.Author: patricia121821
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent eight nights in February and once again were extremely satisfied. The front desk staff are great, the complimentary breakfast is more than efficient , nice pool, excellent location, lean and spacious rooms. Will be staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Palms”
Reviews.Author: JPB56Amado
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Clean rooms, great service and easy access to Disney World. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, quaint, clean and lovely place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: OysterMag
Reviews.Content: As a travel writer I recommend The Palms for business and leisure travel. It is very clean, cozy and just outside the DisneyWorld gates. The Palms offers a very good hot breakfast. Each villa has a full kitchen, living room and quality mattresses. The Palms is wonderful for long stays, as it is as close to a home-away-from-home as one can get. Main routes to all parks are just outside the main gate, and the town of Celebration, with its lovely shops and great restaurants, is minutes away. I have stayed in and tested over 50 hotels in the Kissimmee/Orlando area and highly recommend a stay at the Palms. Dale Nicholls Publisher Oyster Magazine

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, clean, great location and ammenties!”
Reviews.Author: melblake4
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Wonderful staff. Spacious rooms, clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “The Roach Hotel and Villas”
Reviews.Author: JX1
Reviews.Content: I was transferred from the Maingate to the Villas due to the system showing the maingate as active. I knew the Maingate was once the Hamptons Inn which I had stayed a longtime ago and it is now closed. At any rate, the Villas are basically tiny suites that have a kitchenette with all the essentials. Don’t expect quality in this hotel because there is none. Both my girlfriend and I were greeted by the Palm’s designated room roaches. They were everywhere and several times while we were sleeping, they landed in our faces. Since this was a last minute booking for the New Years, I let it go and slept with the lights on to keep the roaches away. This hotel needs to be renovated and closed like the Maingate. Overall I wouldn’t recommend this hotel at all unless you had nowhere else to go.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay and Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: GLQ
Reviews.Content: I made reservation from internet because this Condo Hotel is very close to Disney World. My wife and I with two young kids stayed in Unit 764 for 3 nights during 2010 Christmas time. We enjoyed our stay. The room is very clean and it has two queen beds and one sofa bed that are big enough for my family. Location and breakfast are great. The most impression one is its convenient location. The second day after Christmas was very cold in Orlando. My kids didn't wear coat when we were playing at Universal. We drove back to the hotel and cooked some hot foods for lunch, and then dressed in coats and back to Universal for the rest of day.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed--felt like college dorm studio”
Reviews.Author: CocoabeanHickory
Reviews.Content: My room small room was right by the parkway and it was like I was outside-- it was so noisy. The unit is not updated. The doors and windows do not close tightly and there is a serious air draft. The unit felt small, dingy and obsolete. Checked out the next day. Worth maybe $40 / night. Not the$189 I paid. Very ,very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, great location, can't wait to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: paytonaj88
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I took a vacation this past August to Disney. I was turned onto The Palms Hotel and Villas by family who had stayed there previously. It was definitely great advice. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. My friends and I had never been to Disney. The staff was very helpful with all the questions we had. The location is great. It's not so close to Disney that guests get overwhelmed by all the traffic. The rooms were spacious. Ours had a great view of a pond on site. The complimentary breakfast offered every morning was super convenient, especially for a group of girls on a budget. My friends and I are planning another trip for this coming July to go to Universal and Disney with full intentions of staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value of any hotel that I've ever visited”
Reviews.Author: oceanlady999
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and a great pool. The water was warm and wonderful. The room/suite that we had (#614) was very beautiful, clean, large and comfy. The complimentary breakfast was great, and even had some great fresh apples and oranges to take with you to the PARK at Disney. Great shuttle to Disney. Only negative was that we couldn't go back to our hotel during the day to relax and then come back for the evening fireworks. It's a great place, though, and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: DMarie81
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights, October 2-5, with my husband, my son, and my parents. We stayed in a deluxe double one-bedroom suite, which consisted of a bedroom with 2 full beds, and a separate living room area with a pull out queen. This was more than enough room for the 5 of us. The room also included a full kitchen, and 2 separate televisions, one in the bedroom and one in the living area. The bathroom was spacious, with a separate area for shower and toilet, and separate area for sink and storage closet. My family and I were very pleased with the room, and found it to be everything we needed and more. My son was celebrating his 7th birthday while we were in Disney, and he loved the hotel-----the pool was very nice, and we especially enjoyed the hot tub. There was also a small gazebo area with grills, which we did not have time to use, but had we been staying longer, would definitely have taken advantage of. We thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary breakfast every morning, esp. my son...he looked forward to this every morning. The whole setup of the breakfast area was wonderful, and I imagine very "cool" for a little kid----all the coffee and juice you want, eggs, french toast, waffles, 4-5 different types of cereals, various bagels, toast, and danishes, as well as fruit. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone, and plan on staying here if at all possible for any future visits. The manager and staff were very friendly, and the maid service was nice as well----beds were made and fresh towels everyday...we never had to ask for any extra, they always made sure they were supplied. Wonderful place to stay for a very reasonable price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan523
Reviews.Content: When we decided to plan a Disney vacation, we thought about staying at a Disney property but decided to go with The Palms, which is a Disney Good Neighbor Hotel. I think it was the best decision we made. The staff was super friendly and went out of their way to meet our needs. The kids enjoyed the breakfast in the lobby every morning and were glad that it was more than stale toast and juice. The hotel was close enough to the main gates at Disney that we never had any problems getting there, which was one of my main concerns when we decided to not stay onsite. We are already planning our next trip for early next year where we will definately stay at The Palms again!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT, WOULD RECOMMEND!”
Reviews.Author: LifeisTooShortSoLive
Reviews.Content: We came down to visit the Disney parks and had such a great time! The rooms are large and have an apartment feel, the full kitchen saved us money and made fixing our homemade soup for our girls possible and the shuttle to Disney was very convenient. Thanks Palms!

Reviews.Title: “I want to stay again”
Reviews.Author: casdj
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great free breakfast. Nice rooms and perfect to rest and have fun in the pool. This hotel have transportation to Epcot, and is near to Old Town and many places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Parkway Palms & Villas”
Reviews.Author: Carol40
Reviews.Content: We love Florida and have travelled to Orlando and Kissimmee many times, we enjoy the parks and would recommend staying near to Disney. The palms is a very short drive to parks, eating out and Shopping. The facilities are clean and comfortable and great value for money. We stayed for 6 nights (22 Aug-28 Aug 2010) The staff are very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast is delightful too. There was 7 of us on Holiday together so we booked two villas, both villas were kept very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The staff gave us a very pleasant welcome. The pool facilities were good and kept clean, we enjoyed time out sitting in the sunshine after a busy day. The Location is excellent. We had a really nice time here. Thank you to all the staff for taking good care of us.

Reviews.Title: “More hassle than relaxation”
Reviews.Author: CTWaddell
Reviews.Content: I went into this stay with an open mind and was very disapointed with unsatisfactory conditions. After the second time I was offered to be moved to a different room I was quite disapointed. The rooms were not at all pleasant. The night staff was helpful and they made the attempts to help me but the rooms were unsatisfactory with broken showers, leaking faucets or broken refrigerators. Instead of moving rooms again, I decided to change hotels at midnight of our first night stay. The management did contact me a few days later with great apologies for my inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Truffless
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the villas and overall the stay was good. We reserved a villa with 2 beds and we were checked in to building number 6, at first everything seemed ok...but during the night we encountered roaches and dirty bathroom (room was old overall) when we returned from Disney water parks. Next morning during breakfast I stopped at the reception desk and I talked to a Hispanic supervisor called Brian and he offered an upgrade to a bigger room. The room was very clean and nice and everything worked out from that morning. We have nothing else to say, everything else was absolutely great!! Would return to this place again and that sincere effort and approach the gentleman took to make us happy is called "customer service" and we very well appreciated the good service! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: 03MinnesotaMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the villa. Breakfast was decent, with hot protein offerings as well as sweets and cereal. Pool and surrounding area was clean if not somewhat shallow and warm for the weather. Staff was professional, pleasant and helpful. Location was perfect for Disney as it is right off I-4, but no traffic noise in the villa.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Reiand
Reviews.Content: Friends, sun, Disney, good location and a nice comfortable villa , perfect combination

Reviews.Title: “Crappy hotel/villa - will only cause you stress”
Reviews.Author: dshiznit2010
Reviews.Content: My sister, my gf and I were originally booked to stay on this place July 21-26. They charged us a hotel fee, which to my opinion would've gotten us a much better breakfast. When we arrived at our hotel, we were utterly disappointed. The elevator and the hallways stunk and the A/C seem to work only in the rooms. We booked 2 queen beds and they gave us a small room with 2 double beds. To try to make our stay more comfortable, we asked the front desk if we could upgrade to a villa. We paid $30/night upgrade that turned out to be even crappier than the hotel we were originally booked at. The villa smelled like mold through out, the bathroom walls were peeling and moldy, we found a peep hole in the bathroom, and the place was just dirty. To make matter worst, on the day we moved to the villa, our TV blew up and had a short circuit. There was a small fire that I thankfully was able to put off. The hotel accommodated us by compensating us with the hotel fee. On our 3rd day at the villa, we discovered our room wide open after coming back from Disney. Thankfully, nothing was missing, or maybe we just don't know it yet. After this, we ended up canceling the rest of our stay and moving to another hotel - Ramada, which is also around the area. If you want to enjoy your vacation, don't come to this hotel. If you add all the fees, they actually end up charging more than a nicer hotel, such as Ramada. This hotel/villa is a ripoff. They will give you nothing but stress. The website is full of lies and so is their pictures. If you booked through expedia, the front desk will also tell you that they can't refund your money. Don't believe that BS. Just call expedia and complain about your stay at Palms Hotel/Villa and they will try to compensate you. Our stay at Palms Hotel/Villa brought us nothing but stress.

Reviews.Title: “The advertising for the hotel is very misleading; don't be fooled!”
Reviews.Author: Goose15
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Palms Hotel was nothing short of awful. My girlfriend and I had to store our luggage in a storage room for an afternoon because we arrived there early from a cruise we went on the previous week. We went to a disney park that day and came back and checked in. When we got our room it was suppose to have a king size bed and they gave us a room with two full beds. This would not be a problem but the front desk to the hotel is not actually in the hotel its a three to four minute walk to the villa part of the hotel which is across the street. We finally got the right room then we discovered that money was taken from our luggage while it was stored in the room. We then had to walk over to the front desk and ask for the manager who conveniently was not there. We filled out a claim about the money and wrote down our cell number for the manager to get back to us and check the security tapes. The manager never called and every time we went to the front desk we asked for him and he was never there. Apart from the money issue the hotel is tucked back in a corner far away from restaurants and we did not have a car. We had to walk two to three miles for groceries or a restaurant. The Palms website is misleading with its pictures as well. As the week went on we noticed our room had leaky pipes which caused the bathroom to flood making the carpet wet and moldy. The doors to the room were not sound proof and you could hear everything in the hallway which made sleeping hard. To top everything off the fire alarms even went off for no reason at one time and the maid walked in on me in my underwear without knocking. Three good things about the hotel were its breakfast, room pricing, and shuttles to disney. I would not advise people to stay here in any way mainly because everything about the hotel was misleading and the management didn't care about its guests enough to call them back when they might have been stolen from.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: Hotels4u101
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel and they let us check in early which was very nice.We walked into our room and we were shocked.Our room was HUGE.It was perfest seeing as we were traveling with 2 teenagers.It had lots of space.The only problem is that in order to get to the hotel you have to go back farley far.The pools where big,they should have had the pools a bit colder tho.I didnt like that they where a bunch of baseball teams there of teenage boys and they where very loud in the pool,pushing each other,screaming,yelling,and they through a hot dog in the pool.And not one facilty member came out to stop them.The breakfast in the morning was very good,And I love the shuttle.We didnt have to worry about parking.The arcade only has about 5 games in it.The guest laundry was very handy.Plus you could buy your disneyworld,seaworld,and universal tickets on site in the lobby.They also only have free wi-fi in the lobby.Not in the rooms.Overal this is one of the best hotels/vistas I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised, a great find”
Reviews.Author: CatUK78
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights with two small children on our first trip to Florida. We switched our original booking for this hotel for the shuttle service times to Disney and the buffet breakfast. We were given a room in the 'hotel' or as they call it building 8. Was very happy with the room, maid service everyday....cleaned, replenished items, new towels, made beds etc and even arranged kids toys on bed in cute way, which the kids LOVED. Breakfast was fine and served in hotel lobby or main lobby building, a decent selection and something for everyone, plus you could take the food back to your room so that was good. Asked for fridge and microwave in room and we had both, clean and useful. Location not the greatest, was very dark walk back from the shops at night and with two small children did not feel safe. Shuttle service was good, drivers all very nice and friendly. We used the pool at the villas once and it was ok, towels provided which was helpful. There is a sand box for kids but it was dirty and full of bugs so didn't let my kids play in there at all and we tried to play in the games room but the token machine was broken and all games took tokens so the little ones were disappointed. Our main issue was the phone. We could not dial out on our bedroom phone at all, wouldn't call locally or even the reception for that matter. They sent a guy to 'fix' it and he had no clue what to do with it. In fact he thought he was supposed to be fixing the air conditioner (which was working perfectly thankfully). They offered on the third day to move our room but said we would lose the fridge and microwave and with two small children we needed those things so chose to deal with no phone. It wasn't great to have to leave the hotel building and walk over to the other building just to use the reception phone to order food for the kids, especially in the pouring rain, but we did it. I would stay here again, but I'd stock up our fridge better and rent a car next time due to location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: ssemps
Reviews.Content: If you like the strong odor of must, mold, mildew and stale cigarette smoke, and you like dirty carpets and stained furniture and long, black hairs in your "clean" linens, then this is your hotel. I literally could not sleep the first night we arrived because the smell was so bad. I didn't want to touch anything and became obsessive about washing my hands during my stay here. After our first night, I complained about the room and they 'upgraded' us to a villa. It was better, meaning it did not smell as bad, but it was still very old and dirty. The couch had stains on it, the carpet hasn't been cleaned in years, the toilet ran constantly, there's mold and mildew in the tub and around the tile. I would not walk anywhere in the room without my shoes on. The room was downright depressing. The breakfast was hilarious. I've never seen eggs cooked this way - they were like rubbery disks. I can appreciate the difficulty in preparing food for a large amount of people however, this was very disappointing and no effort was put into it. I would only eat the toast because based on the state of the hotel rooms, I wouldn't want to think about the state of the kitchen. After being out of the hotel from 9:30am - 4:30pm, the maid service never made it to our room. The following day (check out day - yippeeee) when I had the Do Not Disturb sign on the door, she barged right in. Can't win. There were long black hairs on the clean linens when we were lucky enough to have our room serviced. The pool is nothing to write home about and come to think of it, I never saw a maintenance person attend to the pool or any other area of this hotel. No wonder the place is falling apart. This place is far away from everything and your taxi ride will cost you a minimum of $20 one way if you choose to go out for dinner or go shopping. I have never spent so much money on cab fare. To be fair, that is not this hotel's fault however, be aware if you plan to stay here and budget for it. I will say that the hotel staff that I dealt with were pleasant enough and will not say anything negative about the customer service with the exception of the maid service. The bottom line, this is a very old hotel that has not kept up with maintenance or cleaning and it shows. What I find most disappointing is this hotel is a Disney World Good Neighbour Hotel. This is what it means to be a Disney World Good Neighbour Hotel: Disney Good Neighbor Hotels what does it mean? Simple, the Disney Good Neighbor hotels are hotels which have passed a certain high standard criteria that has been setup by Walt Disney World. Disney understands that there are a lot of popular Lake Buena Vista hotels and Kissimmee FL hotels which guests like to stay at. So they came up with the Disney World Good Neighbor hotel program, the idea behind this program was for Disney to set high standards for hotels near Disney World to be part of this program and to ensure that Disney World guests who stayed in these properties were pleased. www.hotels.orlandovacation.com/disney-good-neighbour-hotels/ There is no "high standard criteria" at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kimmyann
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite/villa which comfortably slept 5 of us. The suite has two rooms one with a sleeper sofa, chair, table and kitchenette that includes stovetop, microwave, full size refridgerator and dishwasher. The second room had two double beds and bathroom. Both rooms had a t.v. & the bedroom had a ceiling fan. The rooms also have central air conditioning which is wonderful for a hotel instead of the wall units in some. Housekeeping was wonderful and the room was very clean. There is also a closet in the bathroom which is where the iron & board are and it has shelves to store your items. The hotel grounds were perfect and beautiful. The pool was clean and inviting which included a kiddie pool & hot tub. It also had a gas grill for cooking out. The breakfast was good for a hotel, it included, waffles/french toast (alternated each day), eggs, cereal, bagels, danishes, oatmeal, variety of mixed & fresh fruit, bread for toast and muffins. The only downsides to this hotel was that it is at the end of a fairly long road and is not within easy walking distance to any shops/stores. You can walk, it's just a pretty long walk. Otherwise the location is great, at the end of the road just take a right and the interstate is right there. Which of course is the other downside that it does sit right beside I-4 and some rooms face the interstate, ours did not. We loved our stay here and would definitley stay again and recommend it to anyone. The staff here is great and were way friendlier than the hotel staff at Disney resorts last year. Between the price & everything else it is definitley worth the stay. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Palms - Beautiful and Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: aladwig
Reviews.Content: Chosen originally for free continental breakfest and shuttle service to Disney World and price. Wasn't disappointed with the breakfest, a large variety of foods to choose from including skim milk, one of the dairy products I can take. The staff were all very curteous, and went the extra mile in helping us as guests make sure we are taken care of. The rooms were clean, and the housekeeping as good as any expensive hotels I've stayed in. The hotel was situated back from the main thorough fare, making the stay more secluded and quiet. There were no restaurants on the premise, but it was a short walk to a variety of places to eat along the main drag.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great price, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: CarolF45
Reviews.Content: Based on the great reviews, we thought we were getting a great price (about $40 after resort fees and taxes) on a nice moderate hotel close to Disney, but beware that this hotel has 2 properties side by side.
