Our room was down the street from the main hotel in an old converted Hampton Inn that has been poorly maintained, no on site management and had so few guests it did not feel safe. It was not the quality of a 3 star hotel. For example, the towels were so thin you could see through them and one actually had a hole in it. Also, the sink did not drain properly. The location was good- close to Disney. The hotel shuttle only runs 3 times a day and we did not want to be locked into the times so we drove to Disney instead of using the shuttle. Breakfast was in the main hotel and it was adequate. Next time, we will not expect to get a 3 star hotel for a 1 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: debrakuo
Reviews.Content: My bf and I spent 6 nights at a one-bedroom suite which has a seperate living room area and a nice kitchen. It's quiet and comfortable. The service is superb and breakfast is nice (served at the cozy lobby). The hotel is located conveniently near DisneyWorld (only 1.5 miles away) and a shopping court is very close by where you can get anything at very reasonable prices. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to get his/her money's value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for the Money”
Reviews.Author: travel002004
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 nights at the Palms Hotel and Villas with our 13 year old. We opted for the 1 bedroom villa, ground floor room, near the pool. We were very pleased with our accommodations for the money we spent. The hotel offered an advance purchase/prepay rate including ALL the taxes and fees for about $50 per night, this was available on their website and cheaper than any other online booking source. Our room had a separate bedroom, kitchen area with full size fridge, 2 burner stove, dishwasher, and microwave. Although the room was a bit tired, housekeeping was excellent and very accommodating. The front desk personnel was friendly. Breakfast each morning was also included and they offered a nice "limited" selection. The pool area was nice although the deep end was only 5' deep which was not enough to dive for torpedoes! They also had gas grills available to their guests which was great for those nights we didn't feel like dressing for dinner. Wireless internet service was only available in the lobby and they did have a guest computer with a 15 minute time limited. This was not a problem for us as we brought our laptop and the lobby area was very comfortable for hanging out. But the real advantage was the location to Disney World! We were within 10 minutes to the parks and because of the close proximity to the highways this hotel is at the very end of 192, so there was literally no traffic backups like one might experience is staying further down that road. We left our hotel each morning to arrive at the parks prior to their opening and it was a great plan! We would return for a rest in the afternoon to our hotel and then head back to the parks for the evening shows & activities. We will stay at this hotel again in the future and gladly recommend it to our budget minded friends.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: marynjack
Reviews.Content: we statyed in the one bedroom villas and had plenty of room for 4 adults and an infant. Carpet needed cleaning but otherwise it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay here and intend to stay again. Thanks Palms!”
Reviews.Author: LifeisTooShortSoLive
Reviews.Content: This was my family's second visit to The Palms Hotel and Villas and we love this place. Free breakfast daily, free shuttles to both Walt Disney World as well as Universal Studios and great rooms. If you dont know already, the Villas section has basically apartments with one or two bedrooms, a living room and full kitchen. It's like being at a home away from home and the prices are very reasonable. Right across the street from Disney and right off I-4, it's a great value for us and we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: disney07us
Reviews.Content: Could of not asked for more: Great rates, clean room, close to Disney, Staff was great, Breakfast every morning. Can't wait to go back next year. Will let all my friends to know.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: jterry2462
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 7 days and it was almost perfect The hotel was reasonably priced, it included breakfasts which saved us alot of money for 7 days and the room service was on time and clean. the pool area was also very clean and orderly I would recommend this hotel for any family going to Disney or other parks as it is 5 minutes away from the parks and shopping

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelinwkids14
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and can’t speak highly enough about it. My family of 2 adults and 2 sons aged 8 and 10 stayed for 15 nights in late March/April. We had a one bedroom with kitchen – it had everything we could have hoped for – it was quiet, very clean and comfy, close to Disney, the breakfast was lovely, a nice hot shower and bath, and the kitchen was an absolute bonus given my 2 fussy eaters who wouldn’t eat anything at the theme parks (it meant we could make and take lunch every day and come home and cook dinner). Check in was easy even at midnight – much appreciated after over 24 hours actually up in the air and a 13 hour time diff from our home. The free shuttle service to Disney was excellent, always on time, friendly helpful drivers and very convenient for us – approx 9, 11am and noon going to Disney and 7, 9 and 10 pm returning. Once we wanted to return early and simply caught the public Lynx bus no 56 from the Ticket and Transportation Centre near Magic Kingdom ($2 adults, $1 child) - http://golynx.com/ – you could also use this bus if you want to go early to the parks – it stops at the end of Parkway Blvd on the main road. There was a convenience store about 5 mins walk from the hotel and the Publix was about 20 minutes walk – we all walked it a few times even with all our shopping – you could always catch the 55 or 56 Lynx bus if not up to the walk. A huge thanks to Chris Degenova who helped us with our emailed questions prior to arriving – we were one day late as our 2nd of 3 planes was delayed for 20 hours in Sydney and he assured us everything would be ok with our booking and it was – thanks Chris. All the other staff were always very friendly and helpful. We got a great value for money rate having booked and paid three months in advance, even though we were there during spring break (which we didn’t realise when booking). Thanks for making the first 2 weeks of our 4 week holiday on the east coast so amazingly special.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel with Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Mterry2948
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palms this weekend it was a memorable and enjoyable stay for myself and my whole family. I traveled with my wife and two little children, so cleanliness, safety and comfort are our first priorities. I can say without a doubt this hotel met our expectations. The grounds are beautiful and include a pool, jacuzzi, barbecues, gym and a dining area with a continental breakfast. The surrounding area included ponds with ducks and fish, which our little ones enjoyed. Lastly, the hotel was a stone's throw from Disney World and Celebration, which made commuting to those locations very easy. We cant wait to come back to Orlando and stay at the Palms! -Mark

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: sunnycast
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom villa for march break with our two children. We booked online so we were not sure what we were getting into as you never really know until you see it. We were greeted upon our arrival in a very efficient manner by a helpful friendly staff. Our room was pool side ground floor. The room was amazingly large and spacious. The kitchenette had a fridge, 2 burner stove, microwave, coffee pot and toaster. What an advantage to have a kitchen! The beds were clean and comfy and the bathroom had a sliding mirrored closet with shelving and ironing board. Outside, the pool is heated and the hot tub is HOT! As the climate in Florida seems to be changing..the heat was nice and comfortable in the pool and hot tub. There was a gazebo with two gas grills. We took advantage of BBQ steak and shrimp twice during our stay. We travelled with 2 other families (11 people total) and asked if we could dine in the lounge area and were told we could do so with pleasure! There is a games room, laundry room with 3 machines and a small but practical excercise room. The free continental breakfast was always ready and plentiful. We always found something to eat and it was a great way to start the day. The Disney shuttle bus was convienent and FREE the only disadvantage to taking it is you have to either leave the park before you are ready or wait beyond your will. We were spent about an hour before the arrival of the shuttle and waited in the parking lot for that amount of time (I wish I would've had a car to hop into at that time rather than wait! OUR mistake) All in all this place was fantastic, so much so that we've already booked our second stay!

Reviews.Title: “Arrogance... false representation and not returning there...”
Reviews.Author: Placebo1956
Reviews.Content: We arrived on March 31st and we had our room in advanced GOOD ! There was a charge of 7.95$ per day for newspapers, other services and shuttle; advertisement said : free complimentary shuttle : we pay for it so it's not free.... BAD !! We wanted a key for the safe (advertised if I remember well) : the previous administration didn't give them the keys for the safe they say ... meanwhile, you can leave your valuables in the main office safes... but large only enough for a wallet not possible to put your mini laptop in the safe... had to carry it with me to Disney..... BAD !!! The Shuttle operated by Platinum (doesn't worth a copper penny) is never in time; first morning wa 15 min late for departure; goes only to EPCOT and was 20 minutes late for return from EPCOT; no apologies; rude driver screaming loudly in microphone when you arrive at destination. On 2nd day late again for departure to EPCOT (10 min) and for the return ohhhh suprise.... was in advance ! We went to the other Disney Site; we watched the Night Parade and jumped on the monorails to get back in time and made it for 9:50 pm... The bus was so much in advance that even if we arrive 10 minutes before scheduled time, the shuttle was gone already. A call placed at the company found someone that was supposed to call the driver and get back to us but she never called back; we had to take a taxi for 26.00$ ... BAD !!!! BAD!!!! BAD!!!! The fine print on the ticket tells you to be there 10 min in advance and that shuttle can be 15-20 min. late.. so they don't take responsability for nothing BAD ! The shuttle for EPCOT only departs at 9:05 am, 11:05 am and 12:00pm there is no other shuttle all day... Returns are scheduled from EPCOT at 7:15 pm, 8:45 p, and 10:00 pm; that's all ! If you want to see the Fireworks at EPCOT (9:00pm) don't watch it too far from the main entrance especially if you have difficulty walking you can miss the shuttle. BAD! We have selected this hotel because of it's apparent proximity to Disney, it's not the case. We counted on the shuttle and were unrealistically thinking that we could return for a nap and go back to Disney until the end because some parls close late; you will not be able to do that at this hotel using this shuttle and you hyave to plan your return leaving other sites at around 9:15 the latest, right in the middle of the evening presentations (fireworks, parades etc.). The breakfast is ok, just ok, eggs like the one you find in McDo breakfast, bread, cereals, bagels, some pastries, waffles, coffee is good and juice is horrible powder based mixture... PASS ! The Bathroom is ok but they have tried unsucessfully to hide rust in tub with a mat that can<t stay glued in place so the glue is floating in your bath... guess what, shower is the only acceptable option here (I will not tell you what this glue really look like by respect for your stomach). The bed are very hard but surprisingly very comfortable; I got a good night rest and it's not noisy anywhere.... GOOD !!! This hotel is located far from every shopping centre, mall or restaurant; you need a car or taxi to go around. BAD ! Internet is working but it is not wireless; you have one cable in your room; not two ... one cable be aware if you and your family are internet users, you will have to share the connection. GOOD ! (my wife was so tired ... she didn't request any net time; she fell asleep right after our arrival to the room both nights). The pre-fab message from the administration of the hotel will say that they are doing their best to help you and to make your stay a pleasant experience but I think they don't do enough. By the way, there is flyers from Holiday Inn on each table in the cafeteria area offering packages with free Disney base tickets... I do not know any hotel that will display a competitor rate or promotion on their table inside their wall unless The Palms Hotel and villas is own by Holiday Inn but they are so ashame of this hotel quality that they are reluctant to put officially their logo on the sign at the door ....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great deal - just needs some tidying-up”
Reviews.Author: LordMunodi
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at in a one bedroom villa during our mid-March trip to Disney – and the price could not be beat! We did the internet special and it worked out to approximately $50 per night! The rooms were spacious enough and extremely quiet – we were in building 6 on the top floor that overlooked a little pond, which was the farthest from the highway. It was really nice! They have a free shuttle that brings you to Disney, but the earliest it left was at 9:05am. Since we are morning people, we ended up renting a car in order to get to the parks right when they opened. The location to the parks was very close – it took us less than 10 minutes to get to the Disney parking lots. It was convenient to have a car, especially in a villa to go get groceries. On site, they had two pools (one kiddie and a larger one) and a whirlpool. The bigger pool was very nicely heated, but we have a two year old who liked the kiddie pool, but in mid-March, it was a little too cold for him. They also had a gazebo with gas grills (we made a few hamburgers) and a fenced-in sandbox next to the gazebo, which our son loved. The continental breakfast was excellent – each day they put out either French toast, waffles, Danishes or muffins. There were always bagels, bread, oatmeal, cold cereals, juices, coffee, tea and milk. During our week-long stay, I only saw apples out on two occasions, but we had enough fruit from the grocery store. They had more than enough high chairs and booster seats for the little ones – and the staff even let us borrow one for our room for when we ate-in, which was very nice! There were plenty of places to walk – it was in a neighborhood that had a mix of vacation properties, hotels and residential apartments. There was even a board-walk nature trail close by! We also used the laundry facilities located next to the pool, which was $2 per wash and $2 per dry – quarters only. Even though we had a fantastic time – I would recommend to management that the room needs a little maintenance. For instance, the TV in the bedroom was not working as well as one of the stove-top burners. From what it looks like, there was some water damage on the bathroom walls as well as under the kitchen sink. And a few of the tiles on the bathroom floor were cracked. The one major complaint that I have is that the floors were filthy. I do not know why they were so dirty, but our socks would turn black on the bottoms from just walking around the room. I usually do not like to wear shoes indoors, but I made a conscious effort to encourage my family to always wear shoes until we went to bed. I think it just needs a good steam-clean – or even a regular clean. I dropped some mustard on the tile floor in the kitchen and when I went to clean it up with a paper-towel (which they supply which was very nice) I picked up a lot of the black dirt along with it so I know they did not clean the tile floors – I even intentionally left a small cheerio on the floor (in a visible location) to see if the floors were cleaned – and unfortunately – the cheerio remained there for the next four days. I understand that housekeeping can get busy and overwhelmed to clean a lot of places in a short amount of time, but I just wonder how often they vacuum the floors? I am sure that if I complained, they would have come over to clean, but I didn't feel that I should have to... right? Isn't that part of the housekeeping responsibilities? Other than the dirty floors and small maintenance issues, we truely enjoyed our stay and vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the bugs”
Reviews.Author: limelizard
Reviews.Content: Although the price was right the experience was not what I had hoped for. The photos displayed on the website must have been taken when the building 1st opened. It is in dire need of upgrades, ripped carpeting, drywall falling off the walls in the bathroom, toilet seats so old that they are actually peeling. There were tiny white bugs in the bathroom. They moved us to a new room and there were flying ants in the 2nd bathroom. At one point we counted over 15 while we were killing them. The shuttle bus only leaves 3 times in the A.M and return only 3 times in the P.M the times the bus comes does not match the times Disney World closes so you have to wait 45 minutes for the shuttle. The complementary breakfast had very limited choice and we ended up eating in restaurants. There is no restaurant at the hotel/villa so you have to order in or walk about 6 blocks to get to any restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay, Enjoyable Alternative To Disney Hotels."”
Reviews.Author: arizcat95
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in February, 2010 for son's 2nd birthday. Had stayed there many times years before but the place had become badly mismanaged and had gone way downhill. Under new management now, gave it another try and was very pleased! Will definitely stay there again. Had some car trouble and the GM himself drove me to a parts store to get the problem fixed. Recommend highly!

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean hotel-close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: JackiJo
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for three nights because my daughter was in a cheerleading competition at Disney. The room was very clean, employees friendly and check-in and check-out was easy. We had no complaints at all, it is very close to Disney and the price was great!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, This Disney Good Neighbor Hotel is just across the street from Disney property and what a value!”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoBeachbumguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located only 1.5 miles from Disney's main gate. After eating our complimentary deluxe continenal breakfast getting to Disney was easy via the free hotel shuttle. Friendly and helpful staff made our stay enjoyable. The grounds and the inside of the hotel were very clean. The room was cozy, clean, and decorated very tastefully. Very close to Disney, yet inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: Butch803
Reviews.Content: The website is total and pure fabrication, false advertisement at it's best. The room was nasty and the partying Latinos were never addressed by the management. Live raccons run rampant over the property as well as roaches in the rooms. Filth on the sidewalks and trash on the grounds. A total rip-off. Thank God for Marriott, they saved our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “would retur Again and Again”
Reviews.Author: Reiand
Reviews.Content: I stay with my wife and 3 children, all adults. Great location next to parks, shoppings and restaurants. Spacious rooms, equipped kitchen. Excellent breakfast, large pool and barbecue Gazzebo near the pool. And above all excellent price. is my fourth time here and continue to come again next year. Good staff and very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: nsgrimm
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just okay. The rooms appeared clean enough, the wi-fi worked well, and the staff were very friendly. The only issues we had were 1) The room was VERY humid, don't know why but we had the a/c on and the room was cold but it was so humid that papers laying on the desk were damp by morning. 2) In the bathtub it looked as though a mat had been pulled up from the inside of the tub and the gummy stuff was still left on it. Good thing we only stayed a night so I didn't have to give my kids a bath in it. 3) The door on the backside of the building (where our room was) was never locked, even at midnight. Did not like that for security reasons. 4) The breakfast wasn't that great. They had your basic bagels, waffles, cereal, juice, coffee, etc. That was pretty much it and we ended up stopping on the way to Disney to get something else as what they had didn't really do the trick. Considering the price of the hotel, it's okay just to lay your head down at night, other than that I wouldn't book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our trip to florida”
Reviews.Author: lottiephoenix
Reviews.Content: We got a really good deal on our flights, hotel, car and 7 day hopper pass to the four parks. Of course we didn't realize it was huricane season. When we got to the Palms Hotel and Villas we were kindly greeted by the lady at the front desk. She checked us in and then said to go over to this gentleman and get our hotel parking permit to put on the dashboard of our car. Before he gave us our parking permit, he told us how would we like to get into Disneyworld free. We told him we already had tickets. Then he said how would you like to see Arabian Nights? I said. "Is this a time share program? He said, "No, it is owned by Holiday Inn and it is a vacation ownership program". After saying no and just wanting to go to our room. He said. "It's only a hour long and you can give them your input even if you don't want to buy. So its been about 20 minutes and we say okay. We had to give them $30.00 to make sure we would show up that we would get back after we went. We made it at 7:45 in the morning. The people were really nice but we were on vacation, we should have never said yes. I was stressed out about going for the next few days. After 2 !/2 hours we left and got back to our hotel. If you were looking for a deal like this, then you might want to attend. They started off showing us 2 different condos. One, one bedroom and one two bedrooms. When they sat us down they didn't have any one bedrooms. The two bedrooms were $35,000.00. This is for one week per year, plus a $99.00 fee per year and a $720.00 fee for maintenance a year. We said no, and hear comes this guys boss to offer us a one bedroom where the people were upgrading to a two bedroom. It was only $14,000. and we could get it after the first of the year. We said no and here comes his boss. The first guy said our payment would be $659.00 per month after a down payment. This guy said our payments would be $219.00 a month. We said no, Then here comes his boss to ask us how much we could afford to get us into something? We said no and he said so n so will be over to check you out and get you your vouchers to get your $30.00 back and your tickets to arabian nights. When he gets there he tells us we can get you a repo for around $5,000.00. We don't make any money off of that but we can get you into one. Oh brother!!!!!!We said no. LIke I said 2 1/2 hours later. Don't get me wrong they were all really nice. If you have a problem saying no do not go to this. Just say no thankyou and get to your hotel room. The villas were very nice. We were the only ones swimming in the pool. The breakfast was very nice served from 7 am till 9 am. It consisted of coffee, juice, milk, cereal, oatmeal, french toast, waffles, eggs ( that didn't look like eggs but they were good) A lot to choose from. We had a one bedroom villa and it was very nice. The people at the front desk were very nice. They had a shuttle that took you to epcot every day and you could get a shuttle to go the other parks. I would stay here again but say no to the vacation people.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for Disney Free Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: gronk27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in November last year for one week. Our main reason for staying there was the price (cheap!) and the close proximity and free shuttle to Disney. The hotel staff were friendly and fairly helpful. They helped us get pizza on our first night! The room was large with two double beds and very clean. The breakfast was basically cereal, toast, waffles, bagels, pastries, juice, coffee, etc. It was basic but filling! The best thing about the hotel though was the free shuttle which was very convenient. We were the last stop and it never took more than around 15 minutes to get either there or back and it was always on time. Watch out for the dodgy taxi drivers who'll do anything to get a fare! We didn't bother with the pool it looked small but alright for a quick dip.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in Orlando, Florida.”
Reviews.Author: prdisney09
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very good for family of 5 like mine.the housekeeping have to improvebut the free breakfast was exellent and the heated pool too.we are from puerto rico and we stayed 2 times in this villas. we have only 4 towels in a room of 6 and have no soap and shampoo for 2 days of our stayed.In the other way we recommended this hotel,because have suites with sofa bed, full kitchens and near to the theme parks of Disney,Universal studios,etc...

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price but floors dirty. Wear socks!”
Reviews.Author: VBMOMHouston_Texas
Reviews.Content: We were booked here with a large sports team in town to play at a tournament, so stayed here with the team. We had a king suite for myself, husband and 10 year old son. The room was large and the bathroom was great with a separate sink/dressing area from the shower area. The bed was comfortable, but the fold out sofa was lumpy and the mattress sagged through broken springs at the bottom of the bed. The internet did not work in the room, but only in the lobby. We quickly found that our white sport socks were filthy black after several hours being in the room. The carpet was dark green so it was hard to tell it was so dirty, but we never walked barefoot the rest of the week because of the dirt. The ktichen was roomy and there was a large pantry. Would be great for a large family to store food for a week. Dishwasher, fridge, cooktop and microwave all worked. Housekeeping did a good job, plenty of towels provided as opposed to other similar hotels in same price range. Breakfast was not elaborate but was good and included hot eggs. Coffee was good. All the staff were very nice and helpful. Pool was nice. Workout room very small and no eliptical machine, only 2 treadmills, a small stairclimber and a few free weights. No onsite food besided breakfast, except for very overpriced vending machines, $2.50 for a small bottle of water. There is a small strip center on Parkway Blvd that has a small grocery store and restruants where we stocked up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay ... With Some Minor Gripes”
Reviews.Author: chowowner
Reviews.Content: The stay was in the villas, which are an apartment-style accommodation. I've got a few complaints, but let me say first of all that the rooms were clean, the grounds well-kept, everything worked, front desk attendants were friendly, and the breakfast was better than expected. Now the complaints: 1. The wireless internet was very definitely available ONLY in the lobby, and that was a weak signal at best. 2. Could it kill the hotel to have yellow pages in each room? The hotel has no restaurant and there are no adjacent restaurants. I don't know what it is that they don't want guests to know by keeping phone books out of the guest rooms. 3. Keep in mind that the Guest Relations desk is not like a concierge. It only seems to be there to help guests buy Disney tickets, and is fairly useless for anything more. 4. The hotel was not even close to capacity while I was there, but the timing of housekeeping services was completely unpredictable. On one particular day when we wanted the room serviced, we got back at 1:30 and learned that no one had been there. Being tired, I took a nap and put the "do not disturb" sign on the door. Later that afternoon, housekeeping had left a note stating that they had tried to service the room twice - once in the AM and once about 3 PM - and that the "do not disturb" sign was on the door all day. That was a complete lie as the room was fully available in the morning! This incident marred what had been a good and trouble-free 5-day stay. I would say that the breakfast is much more than juice, coffee, and day-old donuts. We actually sort of looked forward to breakfast each day (though it was the same thing each day, guess it might get old a week in).

Reviews.Title: “Parkway Palms Hotel & Villas”
Reviews.Author: Carol40
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before.Huge improvements to Palms. Great Location. Very reasonable prices. So close to Disney. New Management company. Lovely staff. Clean rooms Great Value all round.

HotelInfo.Address: 3100 Parkway Boulevard, Kissimmee, FL 34747
